intro: Miediega suffruticosa, commonly known as the African spurge, is a shrub-like plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided by livestock and humans.
